intro: Viola villosa var. cordifolia, commonly known as the woolly violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, or pubescent, stems and heart-shaped leaves, which give it its botanical name. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine.
